quest.name: Cooking Up a Culture
journal:
Hinageshi has asked that you supply her with Hannish staples.

※Hannish staples can be gathered from the Hamsa Hatchery by miners, and from the Giantsgall Grounds by botanists.

※Minimum collectability rating for this delivery is 240. Delivering items with a rating of 600 or more will earn greater rewards.
You deliver the Hannish staples to Hinageshi. Matters appear to be going swimmingly, and she is much pleased with your efforts.
objectives: Deliver gathered from the Hamsa Hatchery to Hinageshi.Deliver gathered from the Giantsgall Grounds to Hinageshi.As a botanist or miner, deliver to Hinageshi.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: I've made a list of a few Hannish staples we require to emulate life in Radz–at–Han, and, well...there are certainly quite a few things you would struggle to procure here in Sharlayan.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: There is one in particular which is used to make both vibrant dyes and special spices. Anyroad, best of luck gathering this in Thavnair!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Hannish staples you require can be gathered near the Hamsa Hatchery.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Hannish staples you require can be gathered near the Giantsgall Grounds.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Faculty of Anthropology Deliveries are now available. By delivering the requested items to Hinageshi and raising yourself in her esteem, you can help bring her and Professor Tankin a little closer together.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: We won't get very far without at least a few goods from the regions we seek to emulate. But I trust you'll have no trouble procuring what we need.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: Perfectly splendid! Oh my, how vibrant—you can certainly tell this wasn't sourced around here.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: Oh my, what fine specimens you've found. And so vibrant! Yes, these will be most helpful indeed. Thank you!

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: These rocks are used to create the vibrant dyes Hannish clothing is often known for. They say each color has its own special meaning in their culture.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: These leaves are desiccated before being turned into spices. They're commonly found in Hannish cooking as you might expect, but alchemists there also use them to fashion various medicinal tinctures.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In making your first successful delivery, you have begun to earn Hinageshi's trust.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Deliver the items Hinageshi needs, and deliver them often to improve your standing with the Faculty of Anthropology!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Professor Tankin and Hinageshi take the items you brought them and set to work emulating Hannish culture.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: Most colorful, would you not agree? Alas, one would surely freeze to death wearing these clothes in Sharlayan for very long...

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: And while their cuisine is quite delectable, I must say it is rather spicy for my own palate. Perhaps their love for spices developed out of necessity?

dialogue.name: TANKIN
dialogue.text: A fine hypothesis indeed, Hinageshi! Food is prone to expire all too quickly in climes such as Radz–at–Han's. Copious use of spices not only helps to increase one's appetite, it also masks any unpleasant odors that may come from food on the brink of spoiling.

dialogue.name: TANKIN
dialogue.text: And with spoiling food comes the risk of harmful bacteria─a likely reason for the region's struggles with sickness over the years. I can think of no better catalyst to spur innovation in medicine through the mastery of alchemy.

dialogue.name: TANKIN
dialogue.text: This, for example─a tonic to raise the body's core temperature to protect from the cold.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: Resourceful as always. Thank you, Professor.

dialogue.name: TANKIN
dialogue.text: Returning to their penchant for colorful hues, I believe I understand their reasoning for that as well. Simply put, primary colors stand out even under the unrelenting rays of the sun. Hence, everything from their buildings to their bracelets are made in bold, primary colors.

dialogue.name: TANKIN
dialogue.text: And each color represents different concepts. Red, for example, represents fire. Its close relative, orange, represents the spiritual fire that rages within one's soul─the very source of life itself. This is why they believe orange to be an auspicious color for would-be mothers and the like.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: Would-be...

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: Y-You don't say! My, that is...good to know, Professor. What else can you tell us of Radz–at–Han?

dialogue.name: TANKIN
dialogue.text: Oh, plenty! But I find experience to be the better teacher. So come, let us live as the Hannish do, and I am sure we will happen upon countless discoveries.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: Well, this is all going rather swimmingly! I had hoped this research might bring us closer together, but I never dreamed we would end up living together.

dialogue.name: HINAGESHI
dialogue.text: Of course it would not have been possible without your help, and for that you have my thanks!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Hinageshi is pleased with your efforts. She now considers you a Fledgling Matchmaker!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next request will be available from Hinageshi upon reaching level 83 as a miner or botanist.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake the subsequent quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “A Frosty Reception.”
